symptoms.headache: A headache can have many causes including tension, dehydration, or illness. If persistent, consult a doctor.
symptoms.chest_pain: CRITICAL: Chest pain can indicate a heart attack. If severe, call emergency services immediately.
symptoms.fever: Fever is the body's response to infection. Rest, hydrate, and take acetaminophen if needed. Seek help if >103°F.
symptoms.dizziness: Dizziness may indicate low blood pressure, dehydration, or inner ear issues. Sit down and stay hydrated.
symptoms.shortness_of_breath: Difficulty breathing may be serious. If sudden onset, seek immediate medical attention.

medications.acetaminophen: Pain reliever and fever reducer. Max 4g/day. Avoid with liver conditions.
medications.ibuprofen: Anti-inflammatory. Take with food. Not for those with stomach ulcers or kidney issues.
medications.aspirin: Blood thinner and pain reliever. Do not give to children. May interact with other blood thinners.

emergency_signs: Signs of stroke (FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call 911)

wellness_tips.hydration: Drink 8 glasses (2L) of water daily. More if active or in hot weather.
wellness_tips.sleep: Adults need 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night.
wellness_tips.exercise: 150 minutes of moderate exercise weekly is recommended.
wellness_tips.mental_health: Regular social interaction and stress management are vital.
